definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: His slight still sticks in my craw .
sentences.chinese: 他的侮辱仍然使我无法忍受。

sentences.english: He can't stand this hot weather.
sentences.chinese: 他无法忍受这种热天气。

sentences.english: He speaks ill of me, and that's the limit.
sentences.chinese: 他常说我的坏话，那真让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: I cannot bear it, and can no longer adore my Creator.
sentences.chinese: 我无法忍受了，我再也不会崇敬造物主了。

sentences.english: Henry cannot stomach the violence in that movie.
sentences.chinese: 亨利无法忍受那部电影的暴力镜头。

sentences.english: Judging from Taoist thought, his intolerable Ren Zhen thought officialdom dark.
sentences.chinese: 从道家思想上看，他的任真思想无法忍受官场的黑暗。

sentences.english: I could endure it no longer.
sentences.chinese: 我对此再也无法忍受了。

sentences.english: The pain was almost past bearing.
Holly was forced to move schools after the bullying became unbearable.
sentences.chinese: 当这些霸凌变得令人无法忍受后，迫使荷莉换学校。

sentences.english: And if you can't put up with the noise you might as well save the trip.
sentences.chinese: 如果你无法忍受噪音，就不用白跑一趟。

sentences.english: I can't do with loud music.
sentences.chinese: 我无法忍受吵杂的音乐。

sentences.english: Because you can't stand films that are dubbed?
sentences.chinese: 因为无法忍受译制影片？

sentences.english: My 80-year-old grandfather can not bear the severe winter in the North.
sentences.chinese: 我80岁的爷爷无法忍受北方的严冬。

sentences.english: She can't stand other's comments on her behind her back.
sentences.chinese: 她无法忍受别人在背后议论自己。

sentences.english: I cannot stand driving with a backseat driver.
sentences.chinese: 我无法忍受和一个爱对司机瞎指挥的人一起开车。

definition: more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
to be so in pain as to not want to live/to be so grieved as to wish one were dead
to endure/to bear with/to exercise patience/to restrain oneself/patience/endurance
